snippet: Rising wages in developing countries and other factors have made keeping manufacturing work in the United States a much more viable option, the Obama administration argues.
abstract: Rising wages in some third world countries along with other factors lead the Obama administration to make the case that moving work to, or keeping manufacturing work in, the United States is a much more viable option; officials are saying that manufacturers will continue to add jobs, especially with federal incentives; many economists warn that the recent turnaround might be nothing more than a correction from the depths of the recession.
lead_paragraph: Rising wages in developing countries and other factors have made keeping manufacturing work in the United States a much more viable option, the Obama administration argues.

headline.main: White House Offers Plan to Lure Jobs to America
headline.print_headline: White House Offers Plan To Lure Jobs To America
